name: One-Pan Creamy Chicken & Mushroom Orzo with Garlic Butter Baguette
description: A family-friendly, mild orzo skillet with tender chicken and mushrooms in a creamy parmesan sauce, plus warm garlic butter baguette on the side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F for the garlic butter baguette.
Cut 600 g chicken thigh fillets into small bite-size pieces.
Chop a small handful of parsley.
Measure orzo (about 300 g), chicken stock (about 4 cups), cream (about 1/2 cup), and grated parmesan cheese (about 1/2 cup).
cook_steps: Place the garlic butter baguette on a tray and bake according to pack directions (about 10–12 minutes).
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thigh fillets lightly with salt and pepper, add to the skillet, and cook 4–5 minutes until lightly browned; remove to a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet, then onions and mushrooms; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and orzo; cook 1 minute to toast the orzo.
Pour in chicken stock, stir, and bring to a gentle simmer. Reduce heat to medium, cover partially, and cook 8–10 minutes, stirring every couple of minutes to prevent sticking.
Return chicken and any juices to the pan in the last 3–4 minutes of orzo cooking.
When orzo is al dente and most liquid is absorbed, stir in cream and parmesan cheese. Simmer 1–2 minutes until creamy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Turn off heat and fold in parsley. Rest 1 minute to thicken.
Slice the garlic butter baguette and serve alongside the creamy chicken and mushroom orzo.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F for the garlic butter baguette.
Cut 600 g chicken thigh fillets into small bite-size pieces.
Chop a small handful of parsley.
Measure orzo (about 300 g), chicken stock (about 4 cups), cream (about 1/2 cup), and grated parmesan cheese (about 1/2 cup).
Place the garlic butter baguette on a tray and bake according to pack directions (about 10–12 minutes).
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thigh fillets lightly with salt and pepper, add to the skillet, and cook 4–5 minutes until lightly browned; remove to a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet, then onions and mushrooms; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Stir in garlic and orzo; cook 1 minute to toast the orzo.
Pour in chicken stock, stir, and bring to a gentle simmer. Reduce heat to medium, cover partially, and cook 8–10 minutes, stirring every couple of minutes to prevent sticking.
Return chicken and any juices to the pan in the last 3–4 minutes of orzo cooking.
When orzo is al dente and most liquid is absorbed, stir in cream and parmesan cheese. Simmer 1–2 minutes until creamy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Turn off heat and fold in parsley. Rest 1 minute to thicken.
Slice the garlic butter baguette and serve alongside the creamy chicken and mushroom orzo.
